intro: Rhinanthus melampyroides var. hayekii, commonly known as the Hayek's yellow rattle, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its parasitic growth habit on grasses. The plant produces bright yellow flowers in late summer, which are clustered in racemes. It thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Its ecological role includes supporting pollinators and contributing to soil stabilization in its native environments.
